answers.text:
Hello,
This PM article discussed ERM and its use in the UK and the US.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/4608/Risk_and_Reward_in_Local_Government_Management
Here a description of an ERM system used in Halifax.
http://www.halifax.ca/business_systems/risk_management.html
I also found a very detailed report from Memorial University in Newfoundland called, Strategic Risk Management in the Municipal and Public Sectors. It discusses many aspects of risk management including ERM.
http://www.mun.ca/harriscentre/reports/arf/2008/ARFFinalCooperStrategicRisk.pdf
I hope this helps as a start.
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Rick Johal
text:
We are looking to explore the development of an Enterprise Risk Management system for the city.  However, we are in early days with respect to our current risk management framework and policy...which prescribes a project based process and tool for evaluation and guidance on the development of project risk registers.
Yet, this still puts us a long way from the going down the path of an ERM system.  What I would like to do is hear from others who may also be undertaking similar in-roads toward understanding how holistic risk management influences operations within your organization (beyond insurance, liability etc) and the strategy and processes being pursued (i.e. education/training, top-down v bottom-up etc) to help institutionalize it.
Also, is anyone aware of any municipalities who have excelled in this area?
Cheers, 
Rick
title: ERM for local government
